newsitem.title: REPUBLIC OF IRELAND: CBT Group Q1 net income $2.9 mln.
newsitem.headline: CBT Group Q1 net income $2.9 mln.

text.p: Irish software company CBT Group Plc said on Monday that reported net income after acquisition costs was $2.9 million in the first quarter or $0.14 per equivalent American Depositary Share (ADS).
This compared with net income of $1.89 million in the first quarter of 1996 or $0.10 per equivalent ADS.
First quarter revenue rose by 50 percent to $22.3 million from $14.9 million a year earlier, CBT said in a statement.

"Our solid financial performance continued to reflect our expanding customer base and strong renewal rate," CBT chairman Bill McCabe said. "Our library of interactive education software titles now stands at 379, an increase of 51 titles during the quarter."
McCabe said CBT's expanding partnership agreements with major information technology companies and Internet-related titles continued to drive growth in new titles.
CBT also released its first translated titles for foreign-language markets.

The company, which is quoted on the NASDAQ, said it further expanded its reach into the emerging information technology training markets in the first quarter by acquiring exclusive distributors in the Netherlands, Belgium and Luxembourg.

"We also completed our acquisition of Applied Learning Ltd, our exclusive distributor in Australia and New Zealand. Taken together, these newest acquisitions give us an important foundation upon which to build our business in the European and Pacific Rim markets," CBT said.
